oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Roll of non-commissioned officers and privates employed on extra duty
oai_dc:dc.dc:rights: While TSLA houses an item, it does not necessarily hold the copyright on the item, nor may it be able to determine if the item is still protected under current copyright law. oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865 -- Registers, lists, etc.; Tennessee -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Roster of eleven enlisted men serving in the 5th Regiment in Shelbyville on "extra duty" as teamsters - one ward master, one wage master, and one hospital nurse. The roster lists their ranks, companies, regiments, the names of the officers who assigned each individual to extra duty, their terms of service, and their rates of compensation for service.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: United States -- Army -- Quartermaster's Dept.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Detailed rosters were maintained to keep track of soldiers available to serve as infantrymen in the lines. Men on "extra duty" were not always freed from infantry service, especially those serving as teamsters, but others serving in special positions, such as mechanics, hospital staff, and engineers, were deemed more valuable in those roles than in the role of an infantry private.
